main event: Observers reported sighting a bright object in the sky over Charleston, W. Va. on 16 May 53.
interesting points: The object was described as larger than any star and about twice as bright., The object moved from northeast to southwest at a high altitude., It maintained its course and speed for approximately 2-3 minutes., No sound or trail was observed during the sighting., The experienced observer was convinced it was an unidentified aerial phenomenon.
witness description: Civilian observers, one age 43 and the other age 44, both residents of West Virginia.
